subject: Science_and_Environment
description: The amount of carbon lost from tropical forests through degradation is being significantly underestimated according to a new study.
title: Forest carbon loss 'underestimated'

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: One of the finest old mansions in Wales is making history with a new technology that sucks heat from sea water.
title: Sea's heat to warm historic house

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: Europe's Rosetta spacecraft takes a big step towards making its historic rendezvous with Comet 67P/C-G in August following a major orbit manoeuvre.
title: Comet-chaser completes 'big burn'

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: Warmer ambient temperatures and more water containers in gardens are bringing mosquitoes into UK cities and closer to people's homes, say scientists.
title: Mosquitoes moving into UK cities

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: A new study finds that if temperatures rise and more precipitation falls as rain rather than snow, it will likely reduce the overall volume of water in streams and rivers.
title: Water goes 'missing' with snow loss

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: The UK's exhausted oil and gas fields in the North Sea could be transformed into a lucrative dump for Europe's CO2 emissions, MPs say.
title: 'Dump CO2 in empty UK gas fields'

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: Animal models for Alzheimer's research are outdated and a more human-based approach is needed, say animal welfare groups.

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: A group of retired American football players have sued the National Football League saying the league illegally gave them narcotics to keep them playing.
title: NFL players sue over painkillers

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: Border Collies may be an effective weapon against E. coli infections at the seaside according to a new study.
title: Swooping dogs stem deadly beach bugs

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: Researchers have built a wirelessly powered pacemaker the size of a rice grain and used it to regulate a rabbit's heartbeat.
title: Wireless pacemaker placed in rabbit

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: Some 90% of unique British species are found in overseas territories, and more needs to be done to protect their threatened species, the RSPB says.
title: UK overseas wildlife 'needs protection'

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: The combination of olive oil and leafy green salad or vegetables gives the Mediterranean diet its healthy edge, say scientists.
title: Why Mediterranean diet is 'healthy'

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: The CIA has ended its use of vaccine programmes in its spying operations amid concerns for the safety of health workers, the White House says.
title: CIA 'ends use of vaccine programmes'

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: A perfectly preserved baby mammoth which died 42,000 years ago has been unveiled at the Natural History Museum in London.
title: Baby mammoth goes on display in UK

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: A new species of titanosaur unearthed in Argentina is the largest animal ever to walk the Earth, palaeontologists say.
title: 'Biggest dinosaur ever' discovered

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: The British Museum carries out scans on eight Egyptian mummies that reveal unprecedented details about these people, and how they lived and died.
title: Ancient mummies 'brought to life'

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: A £10m prize is launched to solve one of the modern world's greatest scientific problems - with the public deciding on the challenge.
title: £10m Longitude Prize announced

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: Physicists design a new photon collider from existing technology, paving a way to show that light can be converted into matter in the lab.

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: Researchers develop a collection of new plastics that are recyclable and adaptable - all thanks to a fortuitous laboratory mistake.
title: New plastics created 'by accident'

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: The ancient remains of a teenage girl discovered in a flooded cavern in Mexico are providing additional insights on how the Americas came to be populated.

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: Scientists use a 3D-printed model of shark skin to show how tooth-like scales help the predators to cruise efficiently.

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: A new survey indicates that support for fracking shale gas in the UK has fallen below 50% for the first time since 2012.

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: Antarctica is now losing about 160 billion tonnes of ice a year to the ocean - twice as much as when the continent was last surveyed.
title: Antarctica's ice losses double

description: A lost species of snake that eluded scientists for nearly 80 years has been rediscovered in Mexico, a US museum says.

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: A new assessment of the shape of Greenland's glacier fjords suggests the ice region will make a larger contribution to sea-level rise than first thought.

subject: Science_and_Environment
description: El Nino events, which affect temperature and rainfall levels, can have a significant impact on the yield of certain major food crops, a study shows.

description: A rare orchid is discovered at a Dorset sewage works.

description: An exotic bird is thought to have overshot its migration to southern Europe and ended up in the Scottish Borders.
